title:
Nondeterministic tree-walking automata are not closed under
  complementation
abstract:
It is proved that the family of tree languages recognized by nondeterministic
tree-walking automata is not closed under complementation, solving a problem
raised by Boja\'nczyk and Colcombet ("Tree-walking automata do not recognize
all regular languages", SIAM J. Comp. 38 (2008) 658--701). In addition, it is
shown that nondeterministic tree-walking automata are stronger than unambiguous
tree-walking automata.
subjects: Computer Science/Formal Languages and Automata Theory
